## Difficulty of defining catchments and flowpaths

With the help of maps and aerial images, discuss potential damages due to flooding in Ølnes.
There is a culvert in my [backyard](http://www.norgeskart.no/#!?project=seeiendom&layers=1003,1015&zoom=17&lat=6817577.29&lon=80018.08) that recieved a fair amount of snowmelt runoff. Discuss the size of the catchment flowing into this culvert. Why is it difficult?
What is the risk if the culvert overflows? What could be done to minimize the risks?

Discuss similarly the potential flash-flooding risks and associated uncertainties of the [Bergi hillslope](http://www.norgeskart.no/#!?project=seeiendom&layers=1002,1015&zoom=12&lat=6815372.32&lon=75721.05) above Sogndal.

Example of [unexpected flowpaths](https://www.aftenposten.no/norge/i/7rwM3/Utvik-kan-vare-begynnelsen-pa-ny-flomfare#&gid=1&pid=3) in Gloppen

How might climate change impact this hazard?
On top of this, which additional uncertainties do the old water networks in Sogndal create?
